bug.short_desc: NPE in TaglibIndex.getAvailableTaglibRecords()
bug.status_whiteboard: waiting for verification of problem in 1.5.1

long_desc.thetext:
I have seen the same behavior as reported in 158079 but the actual cause was not a bogus catalog entry as was assumed. I was unable to reopen that bug but I think a further fix is required for this issue.
In ProjectDescription.getAvailableTaglibRecords(), the line:
uri = uri.toLowerCase(Locale.US);
effectively wrecks any mixed-case path before it's passed to createCatalogRecord() (where the null check was added for 158079). For an Eclipse installation under a filesystem path with any capital letter, I believe this invalidates everything in the entire catalog! As far as I can see the lowercasing is not used for anything except the .endsWith() checks immediately following.
Scott, any news?
Verified that fix for 158079 includes a change that resolved this issue too.
Correcting target.
Closing as fixed since WTP 1.5.1. Please reopen if closed in error.

bug.short_desc: LaunchConfigurationWorkingCopy setAttributes(Map) does not set dirty?

long_desc.thetext:
To outline what my use case is, I create a new launch configuration (via API) and it gets some default values and gets saved.
Then I create a map of new values, setAttributes(Map), and when the save comes, the dirty flag is not set.
I can work around it by performing setAttributes(Map m), and then doing another setAttribute() with some key / value combination I already know to exist, adn that sets the dirty flag fine.
Fixed in LaunchConfigruationWorkingCopy.
Please verify, Mike.
verified

bug.short_desc: Persistency bug: processes store from href for selected Steps

long_desc.thetext:
It write tags like these. I.e. whenever a task is renamed or moved the process will be broken:
<selectedSteps href="../../tasks/find_and_outline_requirements.xmi#_fDbgkCY-EdqNHcQ-rAojXw"/>
Need to be delivered into RC1 too!

we could not reproduce it on RC2 920 following is our steps: 1. create a task 2. create a cp with a task descriptor, link td to task 3. add some steps to the task 4. in the property view of the td, select some steps from the task 5. check the cp's model.xmi file, no direct reference to the task's xmi file
<processElements xsi:type="org.eclipse.epf.uma:TaskDescriptor" xmi:id="_sFtjEEnhEduBWrRcHnZMTQ" name="new_task" guid="_sFtjEEnhEduBWrRcHnZMTQ" presentationName="New Task" superActivities="_CNtm4UngEduBWrRcHnZMTQ"> <Task href="uma://_Aw31cEngEduBWrRcHnZMTQ#_Pk5RIEnlEduPEKrLP5IkUA"/> <selectedSteps href="uma://-HoKhWfMd_WWlew8WmXf5oA#_RwqlIEnlEduPEKrLP5IkUA"/> </processElements>
Could you tell me if I missed something?

If element is loaded before its container, like task's steps before the task, the current code could not find the resource descriptor for the task description that contains the steps. We don't see this problem in M5 b/c it worked about by creating the URI with task description GUID (that will not always work). This work-around was ommitted by recent change.
Final solution by looking for resource descriptor from root resource manager in this case.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: [Decorators] DecorationScheduler hangs on to listeners for too long

long_desc.thetext: Note this was originally addressed by Bug 94547 but this is a further enhancement
Fixed released for build >20060925. Note that I am setting it to an empty listener list rather than nulling as we check size frequently.
Note that listeners starts off as null, so I think clearing it to null is safe. If you want to keep with the empty array, I'd suggest using it as the initial value too.
Verified by code inspection in 20061031-0635

bug.short_desc: NullPointerException when weaving with bootstrap agent

long_desc.thetext:
We are using an updated version of Alex Vasseur's LTW agent for AspectJ (based on AspectWerkz) to do load-time weaving on a 1.4 VM. The agent is loaded from the bootstrap loader. However, a user has reported this NPE (see http://www.glassbox.com/forum/forum/viewthread?thread=67).
AspectWerkz - INFO - Pre-processor org.aspectj.ext.ltw13.ClassPreProcessorAdapter loaded and initialized [AppClassLoader@7b7072] warning parse definitions failed -- (NullPointerException) null null java.lang.NullPointerException at org.aspectj.weaver.loadtime.ClassLoaderWeavingAdaptor.parseDefinitions(ClassLoaderWeavingAdaptor.java:180) at org.aspectj.weaver.loadtime.ClassLoaderWeavingAdaptor.initialize(ClassLoaderWeavingAdaptor.java:127) ...
In this case, the code is assuming that ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader() is already set, but when the weaver is loaded through the bootstrap loader that appears to not be a good assumption. I propose to avoid this problem by testing for the system loader like this, so as to enable 3rd party agents that might run before the system loader is set:
if (loader!=null && loader.equals(ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader())) {
I will be providing our user a patched version of AspectJ to test with this change to see if it does fix the problem.
Created an attachment (id=50659) Proposed fix: patch to loadtime module

Ron,
Thanks for the patch. I'd actually like to get rid of the undocumented "feature" ("-Daj5.def=...") altogether that is only there for testing. It means we don't test LTW in a representative way which has meant on at least one occasion (Bug 120473 "Don't Create Separate Weaving Adaptors for Reflection Loaders") we have been unable to reproduce problems. Unfortunately both you (http://rbodkin.blogs.com/ron_bodkins_blog/2005/10/websphere_loadt.html) and Alex (http://blogs.codehaus.org/people/avasseur/archives/001140_aspectj_5_load_time_weaving_with_java_13_using_aspectwerkz.html) have referenced it in your blogs even though there is no mention of it in the AspectJ LTW documentation. I trust you do not rely upon it.
I'd also like to add a test to the suite for these JDK 1.4 agents.

I now have a testcase that not only verifies this fix but will also give us an environment to test custom 1.3/1.4 LTW agents in the future. It involves prepending a replacement java.net.URLClassLoader to the bootclasspath which intercepts class defining and calls Aj, appending AspectJ to the bootclasspath, and finally specifying a custom SecurityManger using -Djava.security.manager. This will be loaded and woven _before_ the class loader hierarchy initialization is complete and when ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader() will return null.
Fix available in aspectj-DEVELOPMENT-20061003103716.jar
iplog

attachment.desc: Proposed fix: patch to loadtime module

bug.short_desc: Export JAR should walk class dependency tree

long_desc.thetext:
I'm an old VisualAge for Java user who converted 4 years ago.
The only feature that I really miss is being able to create a jar containing only referenced classes. The current jar function exports what you manually select. This is not so friendly for large projects.
I've been using a sourceforge ANT task (genjar) to walk through the class dependencies so that my jars are not bloated with unreferenced code. Genjar works fine, but this really seems like a feature that should be in Eclipse.
Sorry if this bug report is filed under the wrong project.
Moving to JDT/UI

bug.short_desc: Calling incremental build on the project before adding to server

long_desc.thetext:
The problem:
When going through the Web service wizard with non-existing projects, we run into an intermittent problem (happening around 40% to 50% of the time) when trying to add the newly created project to the server. This cause the wizard to fail. More detail can be found in bug 156768.
The fix:
As a workaround to bug 156768, which is still being investigated, if ServerUtils.getModule() returns null, we kick off an incremental build on the project and try calling ServerUtils.getModule() again before adding the module to the server.
I've tested out this fix and it seems to be fixing this problem.
Created an attachment (id=50663) Patch for jst.ws.consumption plugin
Patch attached. Requesting PMC approval for WTP 1.5.1.
I've opened bug 158213 to remove this workaround once bug 156768 is fixed.

Just a note to add that bug 156768 (which this bug is trying to workaround) was opened as a hot bug request by an adopter since this is causing the Web service wizard to fail a lot of the times when modules are created and EAR added to the server. This behaviour is a regression from previous WTP releases. Since we don't have a fix for bug 156768, the workaround is the best alternative for WTP 1.5.1.
Patch reviewed with Kathy - looks good. Thanks to Web Services team for being willing to temporarily patch this until we can determine the root problem.
Both Andrew and I have tested the patch in different scenarios and have not seen the problem reported in but 156768 anymore.

+1 I've talked to these teams, and seems this is the best thing to do, even though unfortunate we have to "hack" around a problem that's not well understood. The one saving grace of this proposed fix is that the hack is only invoked in the error condition anyway, so, seems unlikely to be able to regress anything.
I tested this patch on Windows and Linux as well. I did not encounter the problem described in bug 156768 anymore either.
Patch committed and released as v200609220223 to WTP 1.5.1 and HEAD.
Verified with WTP 1.5.1 200609220504 and adopter product.
+1 for WTP 1.5.1 although I can concerned about this degrading performance. Pls look for a better solution in the next release.

I've opened bug 158213 to remove this temporary workaround for WTP 1.5.1 when the proper fix for bug 156768 is in.
Also, please note that we only call incremental build when getModule is returning null, which should not be the case normally. So performance is only impacted slightly in this error condition case but not for the general case when the module has been added properly.

bug.short_desc: Looking for non-internal API for org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.util.Util

long_desc.thetext:
I am looking for an alternative to the internal API class for openBrowser which we are currently using to launch a URL.
org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.util.Util ... Util.openBrowser(myURL); ...
As part of code review, we are not to call any eclipse internal API's and I have not been able to find a non-internal API to call with the URL as the parameter.
Is there a method to do this ? We are on Eclipse 3.0.2.
Moving to Platform/UI
There are APIs in IWorkbench to access browser support and open internal and external browsers. This support is in Eclipse since 3.1. We have not plans to retrofit these on previous releases.

bug.short_desc: [64] Highlight Colors all appear black and Fortran Formating Offset

long_desc.thetext:
Installed version 3.2 of Eclipse with Photran included on a x64 AMD Opteron processor computer cluster, running JAVA J2DK_1.5.0_08 for AMD64 with FedoraCore 3 Linux.
When I run eclipse the UI appears but all highlighting colors are rendered black and when in the fortran perspective the font is not appropriate or the 3 vertical lines used to show fixed formating queues are rendered offset.
I have searched the online bug lists but don't find a bug of the same nature that I am encountering.
I attempted to change the text highlighting colors manually using the "Windows/General/Appearance/Colors and Fonts/ configfuration" dialog box. The colors there also render on screen only in black color. However when I double click on the color patch the color palette dialog opens and the correct color values are listed and shown. Selecting other color register values in the dialog works properly in the color palette dialog , but after selecting O.K the color patch still renders black.
Am I missing something? Incorrect color or font mode when Eclipse runs? 32 versus 64bit issue?
Other applications are not exhibiting this color scheme problem. I have Netbeans, Firefox, and Mozilla installed as well and their text highlighting colors display fine.
I created a snapshot image of the UI but I don't know how to attack it to this message.
Created an attachment (id=50684) Screen shot of eclipse app in fortran perspective to illustrate all black syntax highlights and improper fortran sixed format line positions

Update:
Yesterday, I installed the new 3.2 version of eclispe with photran and also the java j2dk_1.5.0_08 on my desktop 32bit Xeon processor PC running Fedora Core 4 Linux.
Neither the syntax highlighting issue nor the fortran fixed format vertical queue lines improperly rendered problem were encountered on this platform. All appeared to function properly. All syntax highlighting colors rendered properly as well as the fortran vertial queue lines bounding the 6th character position and also marking the end of the 72nd character position.
I am still looking into the problem on the 64bit AMD Opteron. That problem persists.

I'm marking it as a 64-bit issue but it's probably a screen depth issue.
Steven, are you sure youi are running the 64-bit version of Eclipse? Did you download it explicitly?
The colors that are blacked out happen when a gradient is drawn. We need to investigate GC.fillGradientRectange().

I have successfully resolved the highlight color issue. The Eclipse code is fine as is and doesn't require any correction in order to resolve my problem. The cause was that the color depth was set to 8-bit mode.
Based on the screen color depth hint provided by Steve Northover, I was able figure out how to change the color depth settings after doing some google searching.
Here is what I did to correct my problem:
I was able to follow the directions under configuring your monitior on a Fedora Core Linux OS located on the website:
http://www.stanton-finley.net/fedora_core_4_installation_notes.html#Monitor
This required me to set the "DefaultDepth" and "Depth" equal 24 under the "section "Screen"" of the /etc/X11/xorg.conf file.
Also, since I was visualizing the GUI remotely through an "ssh -X" interface on an SGI Octane, I also needed to set the color depth there too. SGI Octanes X Windows server visual is defaulted to an 8-bit pseudo color visual (As I found out through my investigation).
I followed the directions from the website: http://garlic.mefos.hr/garlic/install/octane.html
which said to do the following: Edit /usr/lib/X11/xdm/Xservers and change the argument list passed to /usr/bin/X11/X.
e.g. To change the default configuration from the 8-bit pseudomap visual to the 24-bit TrueColor visual, change the single line: :0 secure /usr/bin/X11/X -bs -nobitscale -c -pseudomap 4sight -solidroot sgilightblue -cursorFG red -cursorBG white
to a single line with: :0 secure /usr/bin/X11/X -bs -nobitscale -c -class TrueColor -depth 24 -solidroot sgilightblue -cursorFG red -cursorBG white
Aftering making the necessary changes and rebooting the computers the highlighting in eclipse appeared correctly.
Note: The Fortran fixed format queue lines are still rendered offset, but I am going to attempt selecting other fonts to see if that is cause of the problem. Hopefully that will fix it.

We should consider not attempting a gradient if there aren't enough colors.
Do you know, were you actually running the 64-bit version of Eclipse?

bug.short_desc: [commonArchive] Need support for ProtectionDomain on RARFileDynamicClassLoader

long_desc.thetext: As an adopter, we need support to allow a protection domain to be set into a RARFileDynamicClassLoader, to be used by 'findClass' and passed into 'defineClass' (which is implemented by ClassLoader).

Created an attachment (id=50671) patch
This is a simple fix. There is a new constructor on ArchiveFileDymanicClassLoader which takes an additional ProtectionDomain object which is set to a new class level variable. The existing constructor delegates to the new constructor. findClass() uses the new ProjectionDomain object to determine which defineClass() method to call; defineClass() is defined in java.lang.Classloader.
Also, RarFileDynamicClassLoader (a subclass of ArchiveFileDyanmicClassloader) has one additional constructor to handle the ProtectionDomain and pass it up to the super.
Reject for 1.5.1. Looks fine for 1.5.2.

approve for 1.5.2
One question...does WarFileDynamicClassLoader need the new constructor from ArchiveFileDynamiceClassLoader?

The immediate need was only for RARFileDynamicClassLoader, which is why the attached patch does not contain the constructor for WARFileDynamicClassLoader. Adding the constructor there now is a good idea.

Created an attachment (id=51252) Patch
Same as above plus a new constructor for WarFileDynamicClassloader.
Approve
approve
code checked into both 1.5.3 and 2.0 streams.
verified in code.
verified by Hari
closing

bug.short_desc: [Connections] Connection Handles should not appear if it connection creation is not supported

long_desc.thetext:
If a type is provided for a connection handle, but given the current state of the diagram, connection creation is not supported, the handles should be smart enough to not show up. They do not support the connection creation but they still show up which doesn't really make sense.
I am attaching a patch where I have fixed this. I'm not sure that this is the best fix, but I can't think of how else to know if the connection creation will be supported. Unfortunately, if the client has overridden the ConnectionCreationTool in such a manner that the isEnabled() test does not return the correct result they would also have to override isEnabled().
Created an attachment (id=50670) My Fix
Moving to the next release, GMF 2.1.

bug.short_desc: Convert Browser from a fragment to stand-alone plugin

long_desc.thetext: The browser plugin as a fragment on top of SWT has always caused us problems, the latest being bug 157852. We should investigate moving to a stand-alone plugin.

Created an attachment (id=50672) patch
This patch is kinda big since I moved many files around, so it diff shows the file deletion and addition.
First, I copied the "common" browser files (those used by both IE and Mozilla in SWT) into the ATF browser plugin. These are segregated from the rest of the code in the "common" folder.
Second, I changed the package name to "org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.swt.browser", to match the project name. Had to change some files in the other projects, also.
After that, it was just a matter of making it a stand-alone plugin.
Two issues: (1) The copied "common" files and the linux_gtk source have warnings, such as this one: "Discouraged access: The type SWTEventListener is not accessible due to restriction on required library C:\eclipse-3.2\plugins\org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.2.0.v3232m.jar". This doesn't seem to prevent any functionality. In fact, many of the other ATF plugins have similar "discouraged access" warnings. Is this something we should worry about? (2) This patch exposes a JavaXPCOM bug (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=353693). So if we do decide to take this patch, we won't be able to until that Mozilla bug is fixed on an available XULRunner build.

(In reply to comment #1) > (1) The copied "common" files and the linux_gtk source have warnings, such as > this one: > "Discouraged access: The type SWTEventListener is not accessible due to
Took a look at the SWT plugin. SWTEventListener and all of the OS classes (for access to platform specific APIs) are all under the "org.eclipse.swt.internal" package. And while that package is exported by SWT, its visibility is marked as 'hidden' by the SWT MANIFEST.MF.
So while ATF works with this patch, if any user runs Eclipse under strict mode, it will fail. Not sure how much of a deal-killer that is, and if anyone actually runs Eclipse under strict mode.
Using platform specific fragments instead

bug.short_desc: Identifier length and data type length for some of the databases vendor doc are incorrect

long_desc.thetext:
Identifier length - such as schema, table, view, column and trigger identifier length for DB2 zSeries V8.
3. In DB2 zSeries, Version: Compatibility Value of schema identifier length should be 128 Value of table identifier length should be 128 Value of view identifier length should be 128 Value of column identifier length should be 30 Value of trigger identifier length should be 128
Data Type Length:
In DB2 iSeries, Version: V5R2 Data type length of CHAR should be 32766 Data type length of GRAPHIC should be 16383 Data type length of VARCHAR should be 32740 Data type length of VARGRAPHIC should be 16370
In DB2 iSeries, Version: V5R3 Data type length of CHAR should be 32766 Data type length of GRAPHIC should be 16383 Data type length of VARCHAR should be 32740 Data type length of VARBINARY should be 32740 Data type length of VARGRAPHIC should be 16370
In SQL Server, Version: 2000 Data type length of FLOAT should be 53
In SQL Server, Version: 2005 Data type length of FLOAT should be 53
In Sybase, Version 15 Identifier length of UDT is not found
In Derby, Version 10.1 Identifier length of Schema should be 128
In MySQL, Version 4.0 Data type length of DECIMAL should be 64. Data type length of NUMERIC should be 64. Identifier length of Table should be 64 Identifier length of Column should be 64
In MySQL, Version 4.1 Data type length of DECIMAL should be 64. Data type length of NUMERIC should be 64. Identifier length of Table should be 64 Identifier length of Column should be 64

Created an attachment (id=50683) Patch for db vendor docs.
Patches for the defect, fixes default identifier length and data type length for DB2 Z, iSeries, Sybase, SQL Server and MySQL

+1 assuming can be dropped for an immediate respin.
We've chatted and I believe important and safe, but you do not document here what the visible effect is to end-user or adopters, much less why "critical", so please add that documentation.
Plus, judging from the many similar bugs of this variety, such as bugs 104071, 113903, 156759, 156954, 113903 can you explain why there are so many bugs of this variety? Is this something that's been broken for years? Is this something where the database spec's have changed?

It is critical for adopter to be able to receive correct data type length so that a record length can be correctly calculated, or in the process of OR data type mapping is critical as well. If adopter depending on identifier length to support it's validation feature then it would produce errorous result.
There are no visisual effect if adopter is not expose those value which can be retrieve from the vendor doc.

+1
Are there automated tests that can verify these changes?
+1 for WTP 1.5.1
I know this got in 1.5.1 build, so moving to fixed. Please verify.

bug.short_desc: Too many "clicks" to set connection info on multiple SQL files

long_desc.thetext:
PROBLEM:
We often have to run 10 or 20 related SQL files on development servers. When we are finished, we have to run them all on the user test servers. When they are approved, we have to run them all on our production servers. It is too onerous to perform the following for each SQL File:
1. Double-click to open the SQL File 2. Right-click anywhere in the SQL File 3. Select "Set Connection Info" from the context menu 4. Select "Generic JDBC_1.x" as the Connection profile type 5. Select "FooDB DEV" as the Connection profile name 6. Select "FooDB" as the Database. 7. Click "OK" 8. Right-click anywhere in the SQL File of "Outline" view 9. Select "Execute All"
For 20 files being run against 3 database severs, that works out to 20 files * 3 servers * 9 steps/file = 540 steps.
SOLUTIONS
Here are some possible improvements. They are all complementary:
* Multi-select SQL files in the Navigator view, then right-click and select "Set Connection Info", then right-click and select "Execute All".
* Multi-select SQL files in the Navigator view, then right-click and select "Execute All Against...". This brings up the "Set Connection Info" dialog and then executes all selected scripts when you click "OK".
* Collapse the Connection profile type and name drop-down list boxes into one. For example, "FooDB TEST (Generic JDBC_1.x)".
* Replace or augment the right-click and "Set Connection Info" scenario with the current connection info in the toolbar as two drop-down list boxes:
- the first drop-down is for the connection profile type and name combined together: "FooDB TEST (Generic JDBC_1.x)" - the second drop-down is for the database name
Hung: Some good ideas here -- let's consider what we should do for this use case.
Good suggestion. We'll enhance it in DTP 1.5.

bug.short_desc: Diagrams: In Activity detail diagram number of tasks per role-tasks box should be configurable.

long_desc.thetext:
In Activity Detail Diagram: You can move the graphical box containing all the task but you cannot however re-size it (in the x-axis yes, in the y-axis no). This means that if there are many taks associated with one role within an activity, not all tasks are visible.
eg: If a primary performer (role) performs 10 different tasks. In the diagram, role-tasks box shows all the tasks in a single row, which expands horizontally and looks very wide.
Expected behaviour:
1. Should allow the user to configure number of tasks per row (at library level) 2. If a primary performer performs N number of tasks. ADD layout mechanism based on number of tasks per row (default is 5, can be configurable) should layout N/5 Role-Tasks boxes with same primary performer instead of all N tasks in single row.

I have delivered the fix to RC2.
1. Number of tasks per box can be configurable in plugin_customization.ini for org.eclipse.epf.rcp plugin. property is : org.eclipse.epf.library.edit/ACTIVITY_DETAIL_DIAGRAM_TA SKS_PER_ROW=5
2. N/5 Role-Tasks boxes created if N tasks are performed by a primary performer. Modulus of N/5's tasks will go to last role-tasks box.
This fix should not disturb ADD maintain WBS order of tasks in role-tasks box. Please test again: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=152806
Test scenario:
0. Create basic necessary elements for common Activity detail diagram scenario. 1. Create a CP in a plugin. 2. DragNDrop tasks (more than 5) which primarily performed by same role. 3. Make sure those tasks have input and output workproducts. 4. Open ADD for created CP. 5. Verify the ADD, should create N/5 rle-tasks for same primary performer.
Test scenario 2:
1. Use M4 build or earlier builds. 2. Create a library or use existing library compatible with using epf build. 3. Create a ADD for an Activity which have above 5 taskdescriptors primary performed by same roledescriptor. 4. Save the library. Close it. 5. Now use EPF RC1 build 6. Open same library that used in step.2. 7. open same ADD for an Activity that used in step.3. 8. Diagram should be opened as it from persistence. 9. In order to get to latest, delete diagram and re-open.
Fix is verified on build RC2 0924.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Export plugin needs to scan and copy the referenced resource files

long_desc.thetext:
Current plugin export copies all resource files within the exported plugin. This has two problems:
1. un-referenced plugins get copied 2. referenced resources outside the plugin was not copied. This will caused missing references when the plugin is imported later.
Solution: 1. scan and copy the referenced resources for the plugins been exported. 2. copy all the resources in the exported lib folder when doing plugin import.
postponed to future versions. no time to fix it in 1.0

bug.short_desc: [j2ee] jst.j2ee uses deprecated FPF api

long_desc.thetext:
The following files in the jst.j2ee component make references to deprecated api from the Faceted Project Framework which is slated for removal in the 2.0 release. Changing target to RC0
No plan to fix in 2.0
This still needs to be addressed. If not in this release, then in the next one. It's not appropriate to resolve it as won't fix.
Please feel free to contribute.
Actually I did, but then was forced to roll back due to problems with branching and such. If you are ok with me doing this work, I don't mind doing it again. Go ahead and assign it to me.

Resolving this as won't fix. For 3.0, we are planning to repackage FPF framework to make it easier to consume it outside of WTP. That will change the package name (backwards compatibility layer to be provided). Under the new package name, the deprecated API will not be supported. The work to transition from the backwards compatibility layer to the new API will naturally take care of removing the usage of deprecated API.

bug.short_desc: classloder failes for JAXB 2.0

long_desc.thetext:
You Export-Package statement on the jaxb bundle does not seem right ...
Export-Package: ., 1.0.META-INF, 1.0.META-INF.services, 1.0.com.sun.codemodel, 1.0.com.sun.codemodel.fmt,
The "1.0." before the package names looks fishy. If you want to specify versions then it should look more like this ...
Export-Package: ., META-INF; version="1.0", META-INF.services; version="1.0", com.sun.codemodel; version="1.0", com.sun.codemodel.fmt; version="1.0", ...
What does Export-Package: . mean? . is not a valid package name.
It does not mean anything to OSGi. In Equinox that is a way to export the default package. I doubt that is needed for the JAXB bundle.

bug.short_desc: Java application is not terminated when running ant in the console

long_desc.thetext: The java application is not terminated. This happens when I run ant to execute my application inside eclipse console and I click on the red square(terminate) to terminate the application. The output stops on the console but the process is still running. This causes problems if I forgot to kill the process before re-running the java application. Any suggestions, fixes? Thanks!

The Eclipse Ant integration does not know about what java processes Apache Ant happens to spawn during the build.
So sorry I don't have any suggestions.

bug.short_desc: [Update] Cannot install CDO SDK using Update Manager

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce:
0) Install EMF through whatever means (zip or UM) 1) Help > Software Updates > Find and Install 2) Search for new features to install. [Next] 3) Add site http://download.eclipse.org/technology/emft/updates/site-interim.xml 4) Select it and hit [Finish] 5) Pick a mirror. [OK] 6) Pick CDO SDK (1.0.0RC9, for example). Note error message: CDO depends on FEATURE org.eclipse.net4j. [Select Required] 7) Note new error message: Net4j Examples depends on PLUGIN org.eclipse.net4j 8) Curse loudly. (Do not skip this step, it's required.) [Deselect All]
(workaround)
9) Select BOTH Net4j features (note that there's two listed, which is also a problem - one is most likely your Source feature, but it's misnamed in its feature.properties file 10) [Next] [Next] [Finish]. 11) Restart Eclipse. 12) Help > Software Updates > Find and Install 13) Search for new features to install. [Next] 14) Select site http://download.eclipse.org/technology/emft/updates/site-interim.xml as before and hit [Finish] 15) Pick a mirror. [OK] 16) Pick CDO SDK (1.0.0RC9, for example). Now, you have no error message and can install properly.
The fix here is to have Net4j Examples feature / Net4j SDK feature include its own PLUGINS and depend only on any outside FEATURES. That way you can install CDO and Net4j runtime at the same time w/o having to start/stop eclipse twice.
If you add the EMF and EMFT UM sites to a clean Eclipse install, you should also then be able to install EMF, Net4j and CDO all in one step (instead of 2-3).
Created an attachment (id=50679) screenshot

We know that RC9 features are somewhat broken with respect to UM support. I believe that the newer builds have solved many issues with features (wrong source feature label among them). Maybe we can skype once more so that you can guide me through a whole promote cycle (including UM test, release notes, etc.)
Sure - when do plan to publish your next CDO/Net4j builds?
I plan to publish 0.7.0 as soon as it works again after downgrade from 1.0.0

After a very quick UM install test, it appears you fixed the problem with your 0.7.0 release, though I notice that clicking 'select required' causes the Net4j examples to be selected along with the runtime. Not a huge deal for me, I'm just glad the plugin dependency is gone.
If you're satisfied, feel free to close this bug.

bug.short_desc: Unnecessary renaming internal elements during XML import

long_desc.thetext: Some internal method elements allow the same names, but the XML import is diligently working on renaming them to ensure name uniqueness. This is not good, although it doe not corrupt the library.
Fixed in ImportXMLService
Fix is verified on build RC2 0921-1900.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Background for read only Text objects is wrong in dialogs.

long_desc.thetext: Look at any of the error messages at the top of any Property Page, the background is white but should be the striped aqua background. The fix is simple really, since these controls use HITextView all you have to do is call HITextViewSetBackgroundColor with null as the color param. I would presume SWT could do this on the OS X implementation when setBackground is called with null as the color, and then the ImageAndMessageArea could call setBackground(null). I made the changes locally and it seems to fix the problem just fine.
ssq to take a look

bug.short_desc: Cannot allocate memory to execute command line instruction

long_desc.thetext:
I run Eclipse buildId=M20060629-1905 with the arguments shown below. I run Mandriva Linux 64-bit on a AMD64 processor but I use the 32-bit JDK from SUN (see below).
THE PROBLEM: it is not possible to run a program with run (running ant does not work either), a window appears to tell me "exception occurred executing command line.". There is a details button but it is grayed out.
Output from the log is given below together with an extract from the top program showing that all the ram is actually used, but there is still some swap free.
--- eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905 java.version=1.5.0_08 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US Framework arguments: -vm /usr/java/jdk-32bit/bin/java Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -vm /usr/java/jdk-32bit/bin/java
---- !ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.core 4 120 2006-09-21 06:45:46.013 !MESSAGE Exception occurred executing command line. !STACK 0 java.io.IOException: java.io.IOException: Cannot allocate memory at java.lang.UNIXProcess.<init>(UNIXProcess.java:148) at java.lang.ProcessImpl.start(ProcessImpl.java:65) at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:451) at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:591) at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.exec(DebugPlugin.java:744) at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMRunner.exec(AbstractVMRunner.java:70) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMRunner.run(StandardVMRunner.java:241) at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaLaunchDelegate.launch(JavaLaunchDelegate.java:101) at org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.AntLaunchDelegate.runInSeparateVM(AntLaunchDelegate.java:550) at org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.AntLaunchDelegate.launch(AntLaunchDelegate.java:209) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:639) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:565) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:754) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:944) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
---- top - 20:03:10 up 23 days, 21:06, 1 user, load average: 1.10, 1.20, 1.11 Tasks: 164 total, 2 running, 162 sleeping, 0 stopped, 0 zombie Cpu(s): 11.7% us, 2.3% sy, 0.0% ni, 86.0% id, 0.0% wa, 0.0% hi, 0.0% si Mem: 2059944k total, 2042168k used, 17776k free, 33576k buffers Swap: 1630556k total, 1456232k used, 174324k free, 271068k cached

If you try using a 64-bit VM does the problem still occur?
I am not sure there is much (if anything) we can do about this, we delegate the commandline (from the run dialog) to java.lang.Runtime and let it handle the process creation, etc.
Taking a quick loook at sun's developer forums there are a lot of memory related problems using a 32-bit vm with a 64-bit processor.
There is nothing we can do about this bug, this is a vm/processor problem. Closing as INVALID

bug.short_desc: Configuration view does not get updated after XML import

long_desc.thetext:
The capability patterns and delivery processes are missing in the Configuration view after importing an XML lib into a new lib.
But if the configruation editor is opened, and the "Plug-in and Package Selection" tab is selected, the capability patterns and delivery processes start to show up in the Configuration view
Fixed in ImportXMLService
Fix is verified on build RC2 0924.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Tree control does not support type selection on Mac.

long_desc.thetext: In the Resource Navigator, try hitting the first letter key of one of the item to jump to it...doesn't work like it does on Windows. The Mac SWT implementation which uses DataBrowser doesn't seem to have added support for this.
ssq the finder does this on my machine. Is there a way to turn this on, or is the finder doing it manually?
*** Bug 210449 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is also the observed behavior in the PHP Functions listing. Looks like an application-wide bug.
This has been open for more than a year; is this something that will ever be fixed?

bug.short_desc: Text, Combo and Spinner controls don't support standard Edit menu items in the context menu.

long_desc.thetext: Right-click on any edit Text control in the UI, the standard Cut/Copy/Paste options should be included at minimum (Check Spelling etc could be added too). This should be fairly simple to add, just set the kTXNSupportEditCommandProcessing/Updating on the TXNObject in the mac SWT.text implementation.
*** Bug 158250 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
The problem is that we can't always use the TXNObject when HIView is enabled (compositing mode). SSQ, why don't we always use HITextViewCreate()?
Should say '... we can't always get the TXNObject ...'.

There are two issues here. First, kTXNSupportEditCommandProcessing is only available in Tiger (not a big deal). Second, SWT uses CreateEditUnicodeTextControl() for a SWT.SINGLE line text of SWT.BORDER. This control does not have/expose a TXNObject. So we would only get the menu on SWT.MULTI line text and on SWT.SINGLE line text with no SWT.BORDER. I went over the docs/web and I could not find any other way of getting the menu in the CreateEditUnicodeTextControl().
Adding Eric -- Any ideas here, Eric?
I think Silenio is correct, but I'm enquiring with some MLTE engineers to be sure.
Any idea how we can move forward? Do all carbon applications no include the standard edit menu for single line text controls?
*** Bug 199138 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 203239 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: OUT params listed in "Config Parameters" dialog

long_desc.thetext: The "Config Parameters" dialog used to capture the input values during an invocation of Stored Procedure and Function seems to list OUT paramters too. I guess OUT parameters are not required in this.
Fixed. All the out, return, unknown, and result type of parameters are filtered out.

bug.short_desc: Option to automatically add file to source control does not add the content.xmi file

long_desc.thetext: When setting the option in preferences that newly added files shall be added to source control and creating a new process, then only the model.xmi is added to the source control and not the content.xmi. If the user does not realize this then the process will be unusable for all other users. They will get an "unable to create this part error" and an IO exception.
Lock library during process creation to defer broadcasting resource change events
Fix is verified on build RC2 0921.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Text controls don't support standard Edit menu items in the context menu.

long_desc.thetext: Right-click on any edit Text control in the UI, the standard Cut/Copy/Paste options should be included at minimum (Check Spelling etc could be added too). This should be fairly simple to add, just set the kTXNSupportEditCommandProcessing/Updating on the TXNObject in the mac SWT.text implementation.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 158247 ***

bug.short_desc: support Eclipse 3.3M2

long_desc.thetext: Same internal APIs we depend on have become API, other moves.
Done.
Created an attachment (id=50750) mylar/context/zip

org.eclipse.birt.core.script.ScriptContext.eval(ScriptContext.java:224) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ExecutionContext.evaluate(ExecutionContext.java:549) ... 50 more

It's UI's bug. I tried setting data item in three types:
1. Create a data item, set expression to be "1". The design will be: <data id="5"> <list-property name="boundDataColumns"> <structure> <property name="name">data item</property> <expression name="expression">"1"</expression> <property name="dataType">any</property> </structure> </list-property> <property name="resultSetColumn">data item</property> </data>
2. Create a data item, do not set expression and click cancel button. The design will be: <data id="4"/>
3. Create a data item, do not set expression and click OK button. The design will be: <data id="6"> <list-property name="boundDataColumns"> <structure> <property name="name">data item</property> <property name="dataType">any</property> </structure> </list-property> <property name="resultSetColumn">data item</property> </data>
In these three type data item. Both 1 and 2 are ok. But 3 is wrong. I think UI should check the expression while user click ok. And alert user that the expression should not be null.
If the expression can allow blank or null, i don't think GUI need extra check. Either we accept null(blank) expression, or model need set this property as mandatory.
When the column binding is added into the list, should make sure the expression is not null.

Model just store the datum and do validation. So if user inputs empty or null expression which Engine can't do right evaluation, model will throw out propertyValueException, reminding user to check the expression.

I think empty data item should be accepted, it's not an invalid value. From the other side, previous BIRT accepted blank data item without any preview errors. So I think no exception should be reported in this case.

After discussing , Model only store the datum , and can't do run-time evaluation. So need DTE to deal with problem. As my prespective, I think it's right to throw out ScriptEvaluationError because empty string is really a invalid expression. So please DTE check thig bug. Thanks!

Qiangsheng, Is possible to fix this, when user creates a data item with no expression, can we just create a data item with no resultset property set.
I manually did this and it seems to work.
The data item definition in the report design should look something like this <data id="77"/>. UI does not have to create a corresponding binding column.
Add check for blank data item,regards
Need gui's co-op in preventing empty column binding from being created.
Just do it as Rima said in Comment 7. Fixed.
Verified and close it.

bug.short_desc: Name checking mechanism for contentpackage is not healthy when handle tailing spaces.

Now, the name-checking behavior of new contenPackage is different from other elements.
The difference comes from two sides:
1. We you create a CP "abc" first and then create "abc ", you can save&saveAll, warning msg occur when you run a next step.(For role, the msg will prevent you from saving.)
2. Checking only prompt once, that is, after the warnig msg notify name-conflict, after all, you can input some tailing spaces the second time, and this time, no warning msg and you can save & continune.

bug.short_desc: Improve compilation unit contents retrieval

long_desc.thetext: Right now the compiler doesn't handle incorrect character inside compilation unit when the wrong encoding is used. This could be fixed by using the java.nio.charsets classes. But they are not available in Foundation 1.0.

bug.short_desc: Double check sorting algorithms

long_desc.thetext: Double check quicksort algorithms for the problem described in this page: http://googleresearch.blogspot.com/2006/06/extra-extra-read-all-about-it-nearly.html

Released for 3.3M3. To verify, check the source code of the following method searchLineNumber method in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.Util. I refactored the same method from the ClassFile and the ProblemHandler classes. No need to have two identical implementations.

bug.short_desc: Adding a new Category to the task list has no effect.

long_desc.thetext: When I add a new category to the task list, it does not appear in the view :-(

I found it out: there's now a move to category in the context menu....
But maybe I'm not the only one being puzzled where the category goes. I was looking for a filter: "Hide empty categories".
...slowly I learn more: I had the "Focus on Workweek button checked". Tht's why empty categories are hidden.

This was a tricky one that others tripped up on, but only in the latest development builds where we made the Focus on Workweek button toggle itself automatically (for the purpose of experimentation). So to address this have now removed that confusing feature, and in general it's nice to see your Task List as a whole every once in a while (e.g. when you first launch Eclipse), even though the encouraged mode of working is with Focus on Workweek enabled. A new dev build will be available today.

delete the private variable *typeName* in the class ParameterBaseDefn and related method when call getTypeName, return the correct Type Name by the Parameter Type(int value)

resolved.

bug.short_desc: Link of chart toc can not go to the correct position

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Link of chart toc can not go to the correct position if a table/list with image.
Step: 1.Create a sample datasource. 2.Create a data set from table PRODUCTLINS. 3.Insert a table and binding the dataset. 4.Add an image that use the row["IMAGE"] from dataset into table detail row. 5.Add a chart and set the toc as "charttoc". 6.Preview as Webviewer
Actual result: Click the charttoc in webviewer, it can not go to the chart
IE and Moziall have the different behaviour. If there are all images above a toc, browser calculates the wrong scroll X and scroll Y values when using Ajax.
Due to browser issue, the scrollIntoView function can't work correctly.

bug.short_desc: OK button should be grayed out when no column is binded

long_desc.thetext:
OK button should be grayed out when no column is binded
Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a data source Driver:net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver (v0.9) 2. Add a data set. Select data set type "SQL Stored Procedure Query" 3. Edit this data set "{call counterInT1(?)} " 4. Add a data set parameter Name: param1 type: integer direction:output" 5. Add a data and bind it to the data set in the layout In the column binding edit page, Name: Param, Data Type: Integer Direction: Output 6. Change the data's binding to none 7. Right click the data and choose "Change Data Column" in the context menu and changeing the data's binding back to data set
Expected result: OK button should be grayed out
Actual result: OK button is enabled
Improve the logic in updating the buttons on Column binding dialog. If no dataset is selected, not to enable the OK button.
Verified in build (200610300630), closed.

bug.short_desc: SQL Editor cannot be used in MultiPageEditorPart

long_desc.thetext: The sql editor does explicitly cast its site to org.eclipse.ui.internal.PageSite in the createActions() method. The IEditorSite interface does provide a method getActionBars() and should be used instead.

Hui: Is there a really good reason why we need the internal class, given that we shouldn't be using them unless absolutely necessary and also that this prevent the usage mentioned below?
If not, let's get this fixed as soon as possible. If we need the current code as-is, then please explain why here.
Fixed as suggested. Thanks Stefan! I haven't tried to include SQL Editor in a multi page editor, so if you find other issues, feel free to open bugs and I will fix them ASAP.
closed.

bug.short_desc: Delete Custom Categories with references to other Custom Categories causes problem.

long_desc.thetext:
This scenario failed by a regression reason. Last PASS build: 1.0-RC1-N20060907-1800.
Build: 1.0-RC2-N20060921-1900
Steps: 1.create custom category CC1 and CC2 under CC1 2.create CC3 3.assign CC1 to CC3 results=> the tree will be CC1---CC2 CC3 ---CC1 --- CC2 4.now delete(from context menu) CC1 under CC3 -->Problem: CC1 and CC2 also be deleted.
Expected Results 1. The first CC1---CC2subtree should remain 2. xmi filesare not removed from the file system

Marking as not a defect. This is expected behaviour. Requirements changed. Please refer to defect; https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=156769
Phong described requirements change in detail in above mentioned defect.

FROM 156769:
The confusion/issues are resolved with the following new behavior:
Library view: - Delete a custom category will be permantly remove it from the library
- Delete is disabled for elements that are not CustomCategory or CustomCategory from different plugin. You can remove/unassign these elements from the custom category using the Assign tab in the editor.
- Deleting a custom category that is local to the current plugin will delete those sub custom categories that are not sub categories of any other local custom category.
Assign tab of editor: - If a sub custom category is not a sub category of any other local custom category, removing it will prompt to delete it from the library
Colsed as a changed requirements.

bug.short_desc: Content Assist of SQL Editor cannot be used in Mult Page Editor

long_desc.thetext: I'm getting ClassCastExceptions. The SQLParserCompletionEngine casts the active editor to SQLEditor. To get the editor that needs completion in this way (_editor = (SQLEditor) Workbench.getInstance() .getActiveWorkbenchWindow().getActivePage().getActiveEditor();) seams to be bad style. In order to get the connection info it would probably be better to use an IAdaptable approach, e.g. activeEditor.getAdapter(ISQLEditorConnectionInfo.class).
*** Bug 158286 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Using the IAdaptable approach is a good idea. But SQLEditor is used all over the place, not just to get connection info. So I guess even if I use activeEditor.getAdapter(ISQLEditorConnectionInfo.class), you'll still encounter problems. Given that, I changed the explicit class cast into "_editor = (SQLEditor) activePart.getAdapter(SQLEditor.class);". Now you can simply adapt your multipage editor into an instance of SQLEditor.

bug.short_desc: Move an element with variability across plug-in may cause out-of-range reference.

long_desc.thetext:
Step: 1. Create a plugn-in "base", and a plug-in "ext", ext reference to base. 2. Create two tasks: "task1" and "task2" in "ext", make task2 extends(or contribute) to "task1". 3. Move task2 to plug-in "base" by context menu. 4. Confirm the "remove reference" warning msg --> Problem: The variability was not remove, now "task2" in base can extends the "task1" in ext !
Remark: 1. The variability is real exist, that is, base plug-in element really can see the element in ext, you can browser or publish it. 2. Extends, Contribute are all affect. 3. Not a regression.
Wrong condition check before removing illegal outgoing references was the cause

In talking with Phong, I would like to add the following: Problem: The design is to remove invalid relationships when a method element is moved from one plugin to another; when move a process element, nothing should be removed. Due to an incorrect flag, the above behavior is reversed. Now, it has been corrected.
Testing: 1. Test moving a method element with relationships that will become invalid after the move. 2. Test moving a process element to make sure no relationships are removed.

Fix is verified on build RC2 0925.
I've tested the scenarios of Comment#2, all of them are OK. Thanks!
Closed.

If not, next time, the file will be upated again.

bug.short_desc: Compile error in HEAD of AptConfigurationBlock

long_desc.thetext:
I20060922-0010
AptConfigurationBlock uses JDT/UI's internal class ListDialogField, which has been changed to fix bug 157085. Consequently, you now have a compile error with APT and JDT from HEAD.
I thought I'd better file this, since it will only become apparent tomorrow when nightly builds are restarted after the milestone builds are over.
Please fix in HEAD and relase the plugin before the I-build on Tuesday (but not now, since that would interfere with the milestone :-).
I added the method back for compatibility. It's marked as deprected. Please let me know when you changed your code.

Thanks for the heads-up, Martin.
I think that the setViewerComperator() method is spelled incorrectly. It should be spelled with an 'a', just as the ViewerComparator type is. That is, setViewerComparator().
Do you want to fix that, before I add a call to it?
Oh, thanks Walter, you're right. I fixed this in our code (> 20060925).
Fixed in HEAD

bug.short_desc: [CommonNavigator] Project explorer: UI issues in the Filter dialog

long_desc.thetext:
20060922
- Open the project explorer - Open the 'Filters...' dialog from the view menu
a.) The window title says 'Available customizations'. It should say 'Filters' as this was the action we called. Note that it should use title capitalization. b.) The description ('Select the filters...' should be on top and needs a mnemonic
c.) The second tab seems unrelated to filters. I would move it to a separate action (not 'Filters...', but maybe 'Configure...'). This would avoid the tabs and avoid the border in border layout which doesn't look good.
d.) The dialog has resize problems. Making the dialog larger flickers in WinXP

bug.short_desc: Cannot checkout projects form the server.

long_desc.thetext:
Dear All, I have a server CVS, version 1.12.12 on a power pc server, os: Suse Linux Enterprise Server 10 and Eclipse 3.2 on a intel client with windowsXP os.
Trying to checkout an existing project (prcvs) from the cvs server I recieve the following message:
*** cvs co -P -A "/prcvs" cvs [checkout aborted]: could not get working directory: Permission denied The server reported an error while performing the "cvs checkout" command. (took 0:00.125) Error: : cvs [checkout aborted]: could not get working directory: Permission denied ***
I have tried to manually checkout the project directly on the server and it works with the following command
cvs co -P prcvs
instead the command cvs co -P "/prcvs" returns an error -> It cannot find the project in the absolute path.
Eclipse seems to work rigth with others basic cvs commands. (eg.: commit,update..).
How can I solve the problem? Thanks Alessandro

Checkout works for me. It is possible that this is a specific problem with 12.12. Given that 12.x is a feature release it is not officially supported. However, I know that many people do use it without any problems. Can you checkout of the repository with other versions of Eclipse (3.1, 3.2.1, 3.3 M2)?

bug.short_desc: FilteredTree must not create the widgets in the constructor

long_desc.thetext:
I20060921-0010.
While trying to fix bug 139798 I hit the wall because it is not possible to access any client data when constructing a custom tree viewer by subclassing FilteredTree and implementing doCreateTreeViewer(...). The reason for this is that FilteredTree creates the widgets inside the constructor and hence it is in no way (except via static fields) possible to get access to the client instance when doCreateTreeViewer(...) is executed.

Created an attachment (id=50716) apply patch to org.eclipse.ui.workbench
Dani, was something like this what you had in mind?
Yes, this should do the trick.
released to HEAD for build > 20060925
It works but I think passing the parent twice could be avoided i.e. only pass it with super but not with init.
noted - released change to FilteredTree and updated tests
verified in I20061031-0656

bug.short_desc: Import to a wrong place for empty CP Process Packages.

long_desc.thetext:
Step: 1. Create an empty CP process package named "pp" 2. Export the entire as XML 3. Delete the "pp" and import using "Override" option --> Problem: "pp" go under DP.
Remark: 1. No this problem for an Not-empty Process Package 2. No this kind of problem for configuration import/export.
I cannot reproduce with the latest source. Please verify it in the nex build.

Still can reproduce it on RC2 0925 build, I've attached an exported simple XML with following steps: 1, New a library and CP process package (not DP process package) 2, Export it as XML
Could you pls try new a library and import this XML as override option? then you'll see the CP process package node is under DP.
Created an attachment (id=50881) Simple XML file
Reopen it as still can reproduce it.

Try doing the export again, and imported the new xml file, instead of using the attached old xml file.
The attached old xml file does not contain any configuration, while a cp must have an associated configruation. Therefore, the attached xml file is invalid.
If you can reproduce the same export xml file, please show the steps and log it as different bug and assign it to me. Thanks.

Hi Weiping,
The attached XML file is valid, since I haven't create any CP in it, just a CP process package, the Configuration isn't necessary for it.
Here is the details reproduce steps on my RC2 0925 build. 1. Create new Library 2. Create new method plug-in 3. Create new Process Package under CP node, named CPP 4. Click File->Export, export the entrie as XML 5. Create another new Library (or delete the process package CPP in this library) 6. Import XML file with override option -->Problem: the CPP is under DP node.
Yes, I can reproduce it with PP instead of CP.

This is as desgined.
The XML schema does not contain info for the parent system process or delivery packages. Therefore, an empty user created process packagge would not know which parent package is its original parent, unless it contains a cp or dp with which it can determine the type of parent.
Close it as work as design.

bug.short_desc: [quick assist] 'Split || condition': syntax error and wrong indentation
Eclipse causing X-Server to crash when running with nVidia drivers

long_desc.thetext:
When an application prints out a lot of debug information on a signle line, it causes the x-server to crash. I have an application which prints out a lot of classpath and other information on a single line. (1000+ chars) When this line comes to the console, it doesn't gets displayed correctly. It looks like two lines where overlapping. When scrolling to fast over that line, or trying to click into it, the X-Server crashes.
This only happens with the nvidia-drivers in eclipse. When I am using the vesa-driver, this doesn't happen, although the debug-line doesn't get displayed correctly neither. It also doesn't happen, when running the application standalone and watching the output in a shell window.
I found a workaround for this by limiting the eclipse-console-width to ~150 characters.
Here is some information about my setup. OS: Gentoo Linux Kernel: Linux 2.6.17-gentoo-r4 X: xorg-x11 7.1 nVidia: nvidia-drivers 1.0.8774 Eclipse: Version: 3.2.0 Build id: M20060629-1905

bug.short_desc: [misc] add document performance tests

long_desc.thetext:
3.3M2
We should regularly run performance tests on the document and text store. There already are performance tests for the line tracker.
The patch I will attach adds abstract performance tests for any IDocument and ITextStore implementations, as well as concrete tests for the following classes:
- org.eclipse.jface.text.Document - org.eclipse.jface.text.GapTextStore - org.eclipse.jface.text.SequentialRewriteTextStore
--
Implementation:
Looking at some performance tests reveals that often boilerplate code needs to be written for performance tests (example: LineTrackerPerformanceTest): typically, a testXXX method does the following four things:
- create performance meters for warm-up and measuring - call the measureXXX method N times with the warm-up meter - call the measureXXX method M times with the measurement meter - commit and assert performance measurements
The provided patch provides a specialized TestCase (PerformanceTestCase2) that does exactly that in its #runTest method. Similar, there is a specialized TestSuite (PerfTestSuite) that uses reflection to find any methods that start with "measure" and take one argument of type PerformanceMeter.

Created an attachment (id=50692) PerformanceTests.diff
Said patch.
Waiting for legal clearance.

Created an attachment (id=53598) License files
License files to cover use of JUnit 3.8.1 code.

Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20061201-0010.
If all goes well we need to backport this to the 3.2 performance branch in order to get results.
The tests are released into HEAD but there were almost no performance tests available recently. Therefore I wait with backporting this into the 3_2 perf branch until I have good confidence.
Backported to perf32_x.

bug.short_desc: [mac] process lists are always empty with Mac OS X target

long_desc.thetext: Open any filter under the processes subsystem supported by dstore. The process list always shows up as empty. The miner is probably not returning the list from the target system (also Mac OS X) properly since its a BSD based system.
*** Bug 162997 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The "ps" command used to fetch the list of processes was not working for Mac OS X which apparently has a finicky implementation. Single quotes cannot be used to contain the keywords for the -o parameter. Commas must be used instead to delimit the individual keywords. The -A parameter cannot be used since Runtime#exec() does not return. -a works, but it does not show "non-terminal" processes, i.e. those on those started with the "open" command or from the Finder. We will live with this limitation for the time being.

Verified.

bug.short_desc: [accessibility] preference page descriptions are not read by a screen reader

long_desc.thetext: The description fields of preference pages are not read by a screen reader on Windows. RSE sometimes uses these for instructions and instructions must be readable. These should be changed to group headings, read-only Text controls, or explained properly in the docking help.

Bug 158296 - corrected preference pages and help Remote Systems - removed description, linked F1 to correct control Communications - removed description, linked F1 to correct control File Cache - removed superfluous instructions and description, improved help, changed button text to include "cached files", made note at the bottom a read-only text field. Files - removed description, linked F1 to correct control Logging - removed description Passwords - removed description SSL - changed description to read-only text field

bug.short_desc: GraphicalNodeEditPolicy#getSemanticHint is returning a localized string

long_desc.thetext:
If the request is a CreateConnectionViewAndElementRequest, then the display name of the element type eclass is being returned. If this is compared against a semantic hint used for view creation, then this will inevitably fail in different localizations and probably in english if the semantic hint is different then display name.
It should use PackageUtil.getID instead.

Created an attachment (id=50694) patch for problem
Attached is patch. Anthony / Mohammed: Please review...
- A localized string value was being returned for a semantic hint which is used a trigger for view provider creation and consequently should remain constant in different localizations.

bug.short_desc: [accessibility] logging preference page not accessible

long_desc.thetext: The logging preference page needs to have a group box for its options that can be read by a screen reader.
Bug 158298 - added group box around radio buttons. Screen readers now read the text of the group box which they did not before.
verified

bug.short_desc: [accessibility] custom controls not accessible

long_desc.thetext: Instances of SystemHistoryCombo and InheritButton are not read by a screen reader. They need to use the swt.accessibility package to intercept screen reader requests.
Actually, these do read their tooltips. However, when they appear in a group box the group box text should be read prior to their own text.
The inherit and history buttons have been modified to read the nearest containing group's text (if any) in addition to its own tooltip. It previously read just its tooltip.
verified
